NetScaler

Available versions


  • ver. 5.0
  • ver. 5.4


NetScaler

Description

Same as v2.0 with valuemap and application prototype added.

Overview

Adapted for Zabbix 3 version by dav3860. Valuemaps included.

Macros used

There are no macros links in this template.

Template links

There are no template links in this template.

Discovery rules

|Name|Description|Type|Key and additional info| |—-|———–|—-|—-| |Services|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|snmp.services.discovery<p>Update: 1m</p>| |Interfaces|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|snmp.interfaces.discovery<p>Update: 1m</p>| |Vservers|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|snmp.vservers.discovery<p>Update: 1m</p>|

Items collected

|Name|Description|Type|Key and additional info| |—-|———–|—-|—-| |SNMP authenticationFailure trap|<p>-</p>|SNMP trap|snmptrap[authenticationFailure]<p>Update: 0</p>| |memSizeMB|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|memSizeMB<p>Update: 1h</p>| |httpTot11Responses|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|httpTot11Responses<p>Update: 1m</p>| |haCurState|<p>State of the node, based on its health, in a high availability setup. Possible values are: UP - Indicates that the node is accessible and can function as either a primary or secondary node. DISABLED - Indicates that the high availability status of the node has been manually disabled. Synchronization and propagation cannot take place between the peer nodes. INIT - Indicates that the node is in the process of becoming part of the high availability configuration. PARTIALFAIL - Indicates that one of the high availability monitored interfaces has failed because of a card or link failure. This state triggers a failover. COMPLETEFAIL - Indicates that all the interfaces of the node are unusable, because the interfaces on which high availability monitoring is enabled are not connected or are manually disabled. This state triggers a failover. DUMB - Indicates that the node is in listening mode. It does not participate in high availability transitions or transfer configuration from the peer node. This is a configured value, not a statistic. PARTIALFAILSSL - Indicates that the SSL card has failed. This state triggers a failover. ROUTEMONITORFAIL - Indicates that the route monitor has failed. This state triggers a failover.</p>|SNMP agent|haCurState<p>Update: 15s</p>| |httpTotRequests|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|httpTotRequests<p>Update: 1m</p>| |UpTime|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|sysUpTime<p>Update: 1m</p>| |resMemUsage|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|resMemUsage<p>Update: 1m</p>| |resCpuUsage|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|resCpuUsage<p>Update: 60s</p>| |numCPUs|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|numCPUs<p>Update: 1h</p>| |Generic SNMP Trap|<p>-</p>|SNMP trap|snmptrap.fallback<p>Update: 0</p>| |haLastMasterStateTransitionReason|<p>The reason for the last master state transition. This gives the conditions under which this node assumed the current state. The current state is available at the oid sysHighAvailabilityMode.0</p>|SNMP agent|haLastMasterStateTransitionReason<p>Update: 15s</p>| |haErrSyncFailure|<p>Number of times the configuration of the primary and secondary nodes failed to synchronize since that last transition. A synchronization failure results in mismatched configuration. It can be caused by a mismatch in the Remote Procedural Call (RPC) password on the two nodes forming the high availability pair.</p>|SNMP agent|haErrSyncFailure<p>Update: 15s</p>| |tcpActiveServerConn|<p>Connections to a server currently responding to requests.</p>|SNMP agent|tcpActiveServerConn<p>Update: 1m</p>| |haPeerState|<p>This represents the state of the failover peer NetScaler whether Primary or Secondary</p>|SNMP agent|haPeerState<p>Update: 15s</p>| |httpTot11Requests|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|httpTot11Requests<p>Update: 1m</p>| |haTimeofLastStateTransition|<p>This represents the time since the NetScaler underwent a state change from primary to secondary or vice-versa</p>|SNMP agent|haTimeofLastStateTransition<p>Update: 15s</p>| |haCurStatus|<p>Indicates whether a NetScaler is set up for high availability. Possible values are YES and NO. If the value is NO, the high availability statistics below are invalid.</p>|SNMP agent|haCurStatus<p>Update: 30s</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} Act conn|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.actconn.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} Est conn|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.estconn.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} IP|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.ip.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 1h</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} port|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.port.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 1h</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} Total req|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.totreq.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} Total req bytes|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.totreqb.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} Total resp|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.totresp.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} Total resp bytes|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.totrespb.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} Total recvd pkts|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.totresvdpkts.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} Total sent pkts|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.totrsentpkts.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Interface {#SNMPVALUE} received bytes|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|r_bytes.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Interface {#SNMPVALUE} received packets|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|r_pks.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Interface {#SNMPVALUE} type|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|type.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 1h</p><p>LLD</p>| |Interface {#SNMPVALUE} transmitted bytes|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|t_bytes.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Interface {#SNMPVALUE} transmitted packets|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|t_pks.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Client Connections|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.cl_conn.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Health|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Server Connections|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.sr_conn.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} State|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.state.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Total Clients|<p>The total number of established client connections.</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.TotalClients.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Total Servers|<p>The total number of established server connections.</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.TotalServers.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} vsvrCurServicesDown|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} vsvrCurServicesUnKnown|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} vsvrCurServicesUp|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} RxBytesRate|<p>The total number of established client connections.</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.vsvrRxBytesRate.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} TxBytesRate|<p>This represents the response rate in bytes per second for this service/vserver.</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.vsvrTxBytesRate.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>|

Triggers

Name Description Expression Priority
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are degraded: {ITEM.VALUE1} <p>Le vserver a des services associés mais tous ne répondent pas.</p> <p>Expression: {NetScaler:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<100 and {NetScaler:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}>0 and ({NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()})>0</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> average
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are down <p>Tous les services associés au vserver sont inactifs.</p> <p>Expression: {NetScaler:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=0 and ({NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()})>0</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> high
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} state: {ITEM.VALUE} <p>L’état du vserver n’est pas “up”.</p> <p>Expression: {NetScaler:vsvr.state.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>7</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> high
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are degraded: {ITEM.VALUE1} (LLD) <p>Le vserver a des services associés mais tous ne répondent pas.</p> <p>Expression: {NetScaler:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<100 and {NetScaler:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}>0 and ({NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()})>0</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> average
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are down (LLD) <p>Tous les services associés au vserver sont inactifs.</p> <p>Expression: {NetScaler:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=0 and ({NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {NetScaler:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()})>0</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> high
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} state: {ITEM.VALUE} (LLD) <p>L’état du vserver n’est pas “up”.</p> <p>Expression: {NetScaler:vsvr.state.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>7</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> high

NetScaler

Description

Same as v2.0 with valuemap and application prototype added.

Overview

Adapted for Zabbix 3 version by dav3860. Valuemaps included.

Macros used

There are no macros links in this template.

Template links

There are no template links in this template.

Items collected

|Name|Description|Type|Key and additional info| |—-|———–|—-|—-| |SNMP authenticationFailure trap|<p>-</p>|SNMP trap|snmptrap[authenticationFailure]<p>Update: 0</p>| |numCPUs|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|numCPUs<p>Update: 1h</p>| |haErrSyncFailure|<p>Number of times the configuration of the primary and secondary nodes failed to synchronize since that last transition. A synchronization failure results in mismatched configuration. It can be caused by a mismatch in the Remote Procedural Call (RPC) password on the two nodes forming the high availability pair.</p>|SNMP agent|haErrSyncFailure<p>Update: 15s</p>| |Generic SNMP Trap|<p>-</p>|SNMP trap|snmptrap.fallback<p>Update: 0</p>| |haPeerState|<p>This represents the state of the failover peer NetScaler whether Primary or Secondary</p>|SNMP agent|haPeerState<p>Update: 15s</p>| |haTimeofLastStateTransition|<p>This represents the time since the NetScaler underwent a state change from primary to secondary or vice-versa</p>|SNMP agent|haTimeofLastStateTransition<p>Update: 15s</p>| |haLastMasterStateTransitionReason|<p>The reason for the last master state transition. This gives the conditions under which this node assumed the current state. The current state is available at the oid sysHighAvailabilityMode.0</p>|SNMP agent|haLastMasterStateTransitionReason<p>Update: 15s</p>| |httpTot11Responses|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|httpTot11Responses<p>Update: 1m</p>| |tcpActiveServerConn|<p>Connections to a server currently responding to requests.</p>|SNMP agent|tcpActiveServerConn<p>Update: 1m</p>| |resCpuUsage|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|resCpuUsage<p>Update: 60s</p>| |httpTotRequests|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|httpTotRequests<p>Update: 1m</p>| |memSizeMB|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|memSizeMB<p>Update: 1h</p>| |httpTot11Requests|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|httpTot11Requests<p>Update: 1m</p>| |UpTime|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|sysUpTime<p>Update: 1m</p>| |haCurState|<p>State of the node, based on its health, in a high availability setup. Possible values are: UP - Indicates that the node is accessible and can function as either a primary or secondary node. DISABLED - Indicates that the high availability status of the node has been manually disabled. Synchronization and propagation cannot take place between the peer nodes. INIT - Indicates that the node is in the process of becoming part of the high availability configuration. PARTIALFAIL - Indicates that one of the high availability monitored interfaces has failed because of a card or link failure. This state triggers a failover. COMPLETEFAIL - Indicates that all the interfaces of the node are unusable, because the interfaces on which high availability monitoring is enabled are not connected or are manually disabled. This state triggers a failover. DUMB - Indicates that the node is in listening mode. It does not participate in high availability transitions or transfer configuration from the peer node. This is a configured value, not a statistic. PARTIALFAILSSL - Indicates that the SSL card has failed. This state triggers a failover. ROUTEMONITORFAIL - Indicates that the route monitor has failed. This state triggers a failover.</p>|SNMP agent|haCurState<p>Update: 15s</p>| |haCurStatus|<p>Indicates whether a NetScaler is set up for high availability. Possible values are YES and NO. If the value is NO, the high availability statistics below are invalid.</p>|SNMP agent|haCurStatus<p>Update: 30s</p>| |resMemUsage|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|resMemUsage<p>Update: 1m</p>| |Service 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} Total resp bytes|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|service.totrespb.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Service {#SNMPVALUE} Total recvd pkts|<p>-</p>|SNMP |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Client Connections|<p>-</p>|SNMP agent|vsvr.cl_conn.[{#SNMPVALUE}]<p>Update: 15s</p><p>LLD</p>| |Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Health|<p>-</p>|SNMP Triggers

Name Description Expression Priority
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are degraded: {ITEM.VALUE1} <p>Le vserver a des services associés mais tous ne répondent pas.</p> <p>Expression: last(/NetScaler/vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}])<100 and last(/NetScaler/vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}])>0 and (last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}]))>0</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> average
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are down <p>Tous les services associés au vserver sont inactifs.</p> <p>Expression: last(/NetScaler/vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}])=0 and (last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}]))>0</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> high
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} state: {ITEM.VALUE} <p>L’état du vserver n’est pas “up”.</p> <p>Expression: last(/NetScaler/vsvr.state.[{#SNMPVALUE}])<>7</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> high
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are degraded: {ITEM.VALUE1} (LLD) <p>Le vserver a des services associés mais tous ne répondent pas.</p> <p>Expression: last(/NetScaler/vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}])<100 and last(/NetScaler/vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}])>0 and (last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}]))>0</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> average
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are down (LLD) <p>Tous les services associés au vserver sont inactifs.</p> <p>Expression: last(/NetScaler/vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}])=0 and (last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}]) + last(/NetScaler/vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}]))>0</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> high
vServer {#SNMPVALUE} state: {ITEM.VALUE} (LLD) <p>L’état du vserver n’est pas “up”.</p> <p>Expression: last(/NetScaler/vsvr.state.[{#SNMPVALUE}])<>7</p><p>Recovery expression: </p> high
